result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Ruppert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Washington County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Conditions of extended supervision are the same as those ordered in the imposed probation sentence.
Consecutive to: to Extended Supervision sentence in Washington Co Case 14CF4

miscConds.notes: If probation/extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall not possess/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment, schooling, or combination of both.

records.addlTxt: Disposition Form

Def appears in custody via video conference & w/Atty Brian Michael Borkowicz in person.  Atty Jeanette Kara Corbett for State.  Clerk: CP.  Def consents to appearing via video conference.  Def enters guilty plea.  Court finds def guilty.  Statements from State, counsel and def.  Court proceeds to sentencing.  Voter Ineligibility, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconvcition Relief provided to counsel; forms to be returned once signed by def.
via video conference; Copy; 1/13/15; Racine Correctional Institution
Arraignment on January 13, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Def via video conference & by Atty Brian Michael Borkowicz in person.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Def consents to appear via video.  Agreement reached, however, plea questionnaire not signed.  Court does not proceed w/sentencing today and adjourns arraignment; def to appear via video.  Arraignment scheduled for January 13, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
via video conference; Copy; 11/26/14; Racine Correctional Institution
Arraignment on November 26, 2014 at 09:45 am.

Def via video conference & by Atty Brian Michael Borkowicz in court.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Def consents to appearing via video conference.  Def's motion to suppress.  WITNESSES:  Dep M Dombrowski (WCSD); Dep B Giese (WCSD); Michael R.  Argument from counsel.  Court puts findings on record; motion denied.  Def consents to appear by video for next hearing; State to prepare OTP.  Arraignment scheduled for November 26, 2014 at 09:45 am.
via video conference; Copy; 11/10/14; Racine Correctional Institution

Motion hearing on November 10, 2014 at 10:00 am; CORRECTED notice sent to indicate hearing on 11-10-14 at 10:00am is for def's motion to suppress (previous notice incorrectly stated this day/time was for peliminary hearing).  Counsel/State also advised via email.
Preliminary hearing on November 10, 2014 at 10:00 am.
PH set 11-10-14 at 10:00am per call to Atty Borkowicz; notice sent - COC to make arrangements for def to appear via video.  DA notified via email and notice sent.
Defendant's Motion to Suppress Fruits of Illegal Arrest

Def via video conference & by Atty Brian Michael Borkowicz in person.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Counsel files motion to suppress.  Def waives preliminary hearing.  Court questions def and accepts waiver.  Court questions counsel re motion to suppress; def willing to appear via video.  Clerk will call counsel to schedule; State to check on witness availability.
via video conference; Copy; 10/22/14; Racine Correctional Institution
Hearing on October 22, 2014 at 09:45 am.

Def appears by video conference & w/Atty Brian Michael Borkowicz.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State. Discovery rec'd, anticipates filing motion to suppress the arrest by this Friday, just met w/ def today; Court advises counsel preliminary hearing must be held prior to scheduling of motion to suppress; Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing. Def to appear by video, State to prepare OTP.  Hearing scheduled for October 22, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Def appears via video conference.  Atty Peter J Cannon for State.  Clerk: CP.  Court reads complaint to defendant.  Def advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Def currently incarcerated due to serving revocation sentence.  Def will be completing paperwork for SPD representation; def requests to proceed to sentencing quickly.  Court sets $3,000 signature bond.  Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts waiver.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing and to allow defendant to appear with an attorney; def to appear via video conference for next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for October 8, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
